Dear Sheffield City Council,
At the end of this request I have provided a list of premiership football teams and the local authority in which they are based. Your local authority is in the list because one, or more than one of these clubs, is in your local authority.
Please answer the following question in relation to the club that is in your area:
1.In relation the the club/s in your area please supply me with copies of all RIDDOR
reports you hold (by hold, I mean that have come to your attention even if they were logged
directly with the HSE) that took place at that location/s and the date of the
accident/occurrence is from 1.11.22 to 1.11.23.
Please note that I accept the names of people will need to be redacted from the reports to
comply with S.40 of the Act.
List of Clubs and Local Authorities.
Arsenal	Islington
Aston Villa	Birmingham
Bournemouth	Bournemouth
Brentford	Hounslow
Brighton 	Brighton

Manchester United	Trafford
Newcastle	Newcastle
Notts Forest	Nottingham
Sheffield United	Sheffield
Tottenham Hotspur	Haringey
West Ham	Newham
Wolves	Wolverhampton
Yours faithfully,
Matthew Davis

Dear Matthew Davis,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Football RIDDOR
which we received on 22/12/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Please see attached RIDDOR reports of accidents that took place at that
location/s and the date of the accident/occurrence from 1.11.22 to
1.11.23.
Please note that the names and details of individuals have been redacted
under section 40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the grounds
that these are personal data and disclosure would contravene the data
protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection
Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and
transparent.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
